main_definition: Gzip is a compression utility used to compress files, typically in the context of web development and file management.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A computer software tool for data compression and decompression.
meanings_and_examples.example: The gzip command was used to compress all JavaScript and CSS files on the website.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reduce file size by applying a lossless data compression algorithm.
meanings_and_examples.example: By using gzip, I managed to decrease the size of my log files significantly without losing any information.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An acronym for 'Garibaldi e ZIP International' or 'g/zip archive', but it doesn't actually represent those names.
meanings_and_examples.example: Many people mistakenly think gzip is named after Garibaldi, when in fact its name stems from the '.gz' file extension used for compressed files.
